note_content.Chief Complaint: Experiencing decreased vision and discomfort in the right eye
note_content.History of Present Illness: • Sudden onset of blurry vision past week • Mild to moderate discomfort • No history of such symptoms previously
note_content.Past Medical History: Diagnosed with hypertension and type 2 diabetes
note_content.Family History: Mother has advanced glaucoma, Father had cataracts in his late 60s.
note_content.Social History: Robert is a retired school teacher, non-smoker and occasionally drinks alcohol.
note_content.The Review of Systems: Reports general well-being with no other systemic complaints.
note_content.Physical Examination: • Visual acuity: right eye 20/50, left eye 20/20 • Slit lamp examination of the right eye shows slight corneal abrasion • Fundoscopy reveals stable diabetic retinopathy
note_content.Investigations: Recommended comprehensive eye exam and follow-up with retinal specialist
note_content.Assessment and Plan: • Immediate treatment for corneal abrasion with antibiotic eye drops • Close monitoring of diabetic retinopathy • Regular follow-ups every six months or as required • Advised control of blood sugar and hypertension to minimize vision-related complications
